author: Drew FitzGerald
title: Satellite Operators Pitch Plan to Share Airwaves
text:
Two top commercial satellite operators agreed to team up on a plan to clear some of their wireless spectrum for use by other companies, a move they say will spur new telecom investment.

SES SA said it will join Intelsat SAâ€™s campaign to keep serving U.S. customers in a chunk of the C-band, a swath of airwaves in the middle of the broader radio spectrum, while allowing other wireless operators to take over a smaller sliver of the band. The companies said they serve about 90% of the U.S. market in the C-band, which media companies...
